website_summaries.verdict: A lifesaver for teaching many abstract beginner and intermediate math concepts.
pros: Works well for Common Core and traditional math teaching
Helpful for addition, subtraction, carrying, and more
Great for showing place value, decimals, and cubic measurements
cons: It might be helpful to have more 10-rods

customer_reviews.title: What do you get with your set?
customer_reviews.text: I really like these I use them for homeschooling. There is 1000 block that is red. There are 10 blue hundreds blocks, the tens are green and there are 10 of them. There are a hundred yellow pieces which are the ones. My 6 year old is able to better understand how place value works when he can visually see it. I feel like these are very durable and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rainstar

customer_reviews.title: You Want to Have These!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect amount of pieces for homeschooling parents! I have already shared them with other parents that are struggling to connect with their stuck-at-home-because-of-covid students and they are invaluable. I definitely recommend these for all parents! They make math become physical and visual, and this set in particular is well made. I also appreciate that they color code the blocks so that children can differentiate between the number sets more easily. Great product! Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Usable Set
customer_reviews.text: The place value blocks are very durable. They are solid, not flimsy and hollow. I was pleased that they are nice enough to stand up in a classroom environment even though we are using them for virtual learning at home. The set comes with one Thousands cube, 10 Hundreds blocks, 10 Tens sticks, and 100 Ones cubes. I do wish we had a few extras because kids are notorious for losing pieces. I'm very pleased with this purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: This set is very misleading. I thought it came with a set for 121 students not 121 pieces! As an educator who was looking for a class set and enough to send home to use for extra practice I am disappointed. In the future please change the wording from set, a group of things that belong together, to pieces, an item of a particular type forming a set.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described but quickly realized I needed more ten blocks. I was a little annoyed they don't sell extra green ten rods, I had to buy them in blue. Using these for my autistic son and I guess we'll see if the different colors bother him when we get going.
customer_reviews.author: PGK21

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Base Ten Blocks
customer_reviews.text: These base ten blocks are great! They are the perfect size and seem quite durable. The unit cubes align perfectly with the marks on the tens rods, as do the tens rods on the hundreds flats, making easy for little ones to identify that 10 units is equal to 1 rod. I would highly recommend these base ten blocks!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina J.

customer_reviews.title: Great with Singapore Math
customer_reviews.text: We use this with Singapore Common Core math. They are perfect and are a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. It really helps bring the concepts to an understandable level. They are sturdy and durable. They come with brief instructions and suggestions for use which was much appreciated. Definitely worth the investment to help instruct math concepts.
customer_reviews.author: TruthRevealer

customer_reviews.title: Great assist to virtual learning
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Virtual learning with a 6 year old made this purchase necessary. He does pretty good with his math learning, but I was looking for something a little extra to help with at home. I'm happy we have been able to incorporate a little fun into the "bear" that is virtual learning. God bless the teachers of the world! You are very much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: TonjaB

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year old is going to montessory and he was using the bids at school. Now he can perfectly use these educational package to practice addition and subtraction. The quality is good. And the colors are lovely
customer_reviews.author: ButterCake

customer_reviews.title: Great resource!
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased these I really expected them to not be great. I thought they would be cheaply made but hoped they would work for the time I needed them to. When I opened them, I was pleasantly surprised! They are a very sturdy plastic and the colors are vibrant. And my girls LOVE playing with them and making numbers!
customer_reviews.author: Traci Gold

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool helpers
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for lots of stuff and my kids always love working with anything they can get their hands on. These work great at helping explain and visualize various math topics
customer_reviews.author: Emily Roell

customer_reviews.title: I liked the set and my 6 year old is using ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the set and my 6 year old is using them, they are helpful. They arrived promptly, which was great because we needed to use them immediately. I wish they could be broken down even though they are 10s 100s and 1000s
customer_reviews.author: Hoyas CPD

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement blocks for math!
customer_reviews.text: Such a wonderful pack! We are using it with the Math U See curriculum. Good quality blocks, fun colors and work just like the ones that are made for the program.
customer_reviews.author: Lele jen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for homeschool
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver!!! We were needing help with decimals and counting for homeschool work. This helped the boys so much with the visual aid. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Great, well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Great, well packaged, but ordered one and got two--think the computer got stuck in the processing somewhere. Use the blocks with several students.
customer_reviews.author: Anniebee

customer_reviews.title: Great e-learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Especially with e-learning, the product allows for better visual math concepts. My daughter LOVES math and this gave her an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Reesha

customer_reviews.title: Used in classrooms great for younger children
customer_reviews.text: These are just like the ones I used as a teacher. Very helpful for learning addition and subtraction by using manipulatives. And place value
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to help children with their homework, or for home activities.. It's very helpful to them..
customer_reviews.author: Leer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful learning tool
customer_reviews.text: These blocks were helpful in teaching a struggling student how our base 10 system works as it relates to borrowing and carrying over when subtracting or adding large numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will be purchasing again
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful for math with my homeschooler. I should’ve bought two sets though. We didn’t have enough tens.
customer_reviews.author: Wyldmum

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeschooling and more
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo loves these. Bought the set during coviducation and will be using for years to come. Great manipulative for kids who have a hard time grasping math concepts on paper. Because they are 3-d, you can use these for years as your kiddo starts on m ore complex match concepts like volume.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast. Good quality. Nice resource to have to building math skills. Wish they were magnetic, though.
customer_reviews.author: kyle maksuta

customer_reviews.title: Essential must have for homeschooling!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these! My son has learning disabilities & subtraction with regrouping is such a hard concept for him to grasp. Using these is the only way he's able to truly understand regrouping. Love them so much I'm buying another set.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Herod

customer_reviews.title: Good aid for learning.
customer_reviews.text: I have three homeschooling kids. Ages 7, 5, and 4. I am using these and will use them a lot in future as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect set! We bought this to supplement our kindergarten son’s online/distance learning
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Brackbill

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to learn numbers and math...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to teach the basics of arithmetic - plus, minus, and multiplication.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Learning
customer_reviews.text: My son has ADHD and these make his kinesthetic self learn well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and don't interconnect
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn't expect these to be so small, they are VERY tiny. They also don't interconnect which is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Huish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool!
customer_reviews.text: These manipulatives are my favorite for teaching all kinds of things, especially K-2 math.
customer_reviews.author: Tarah Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great for virtual school students!
customer_reviews.text: My children are virtual school students and these were perfect for my 1st grader to use doing math lessons. I wish the school provided these but I’m glad these were affordable and the set had the right amount to cover our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Krysti

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed and teacher suggested
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed to advance in early math and will carry us through another grade or two. Awesome product
customer_reviews.author: michelle s.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are so essential to help children count and learn how larger digit numbers work and how to learn from expanding a number with these base ten blocks. This tool is better in the plastic for as they will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: awesome math tools
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for teaching second grade common core math!!
customer_reviews.author: jpearson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Should have ordered these a long time ago! Perfect for homeschooling
customer_reviews.author: Jody Day

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for visual leaning
customer_reviews.text: These work amazing for teaching your kids place value. My son is very visual when it comes to learning, so these help him get a clear ideal of what we are leaning about.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my struggling kiddo to learn math at home!
customer_reviews.author: L.Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids learning place value
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loved this kit. His teacher loved it too. Pieces are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of boys

customer_reviews.title: New math using basic ten blocks
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed for our grandson to be able to do his math homework. He's taught daily in class to use these and when he gets home is confused on how to compute the math with out it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Hume

customer_reviews.title: Great for Place Value concepts
customer_reviews.text: Fair price, good product, makes abstract concepts more visual for younger learner's.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zellner

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: They are great, but there came with missing parts. 😳😓 and that’s why I’m giving it 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Great find for teachers and parents!
customer_reviews.text: Great use for small group or one-to-one tutoring with students! Great for visual comprehension and manipulation with numbers. Super adaptable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Kern

customer_reviews.title: Math help
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my daughter to get the concept “off paper”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appropriate for modeling or 1 on 1
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this! There are not enough ten rods for my liking but otherwise it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Nowalinski

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Really helped me to teach my daughter second grade math when I started homeschooling. Love this item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Fruciano

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These really help my son with his math. He is a very hands on kid. The visual and value is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the multi-colors
customer_reviews.text: Love the multi-colors. It makes it much easier for children to differentiate units, tens, hundreds and thousands. Someone was thinking when they did this.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not enough RODS.
customer_reviews.text: Only 10 rods in the package makes it pretty well useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nell

product_meta.title: Edx Education Four Color Plastic Base Ten Set - in Home Learning Manipulative for Early Math - Set of 121 - Teach Kids Number Concepts, Place Value and Volume
product_meta.description: These brightly color-coded, plastic base ten blocks visually represent ones, tens, hundreds and thousands so students can visualize and quickly differentiate place value. The set includes 100 yellow cubes, 10 green rods, 10 blue flats, and 1 red thousand block. These hands-on teaching tools are designed to last for years and they're easy to keep clean. For ages 3+ || Size of thousands cube: 10cm L x 10cm W x 10cm H; size of unit 1cm sides.
feature_bullets: COLOR CODED FOR LEARNING -- These plastic base ten counting blocks include 100 yellow units, 10 green rods, 10 blue flats and 1 red cube. Practice decimals, place value, counting, operations and more.
HANDS-ON LEARNING --These math cubes allow students to create visual representations of arithmetic and algebra exercises using the ones, tens, hundreds and thousands cubes.
HELP KIDS ACHIEVE MATH STANDARDS -- This base ten set can help kids understand grade-appropriate math material such as place value, decimals, length and volume.
BUILT TO LAST -- Made from durable plastic, these decimal base ten blocks can withstand numerous drops and years of use. They're also easily washable.
PERFECT FOR HOME OR SCHOOL USE -- A staple learning resource for classrooms, this set of counting blocks is small enough to be used at home. Keep a set with your teaching or homeschooling supplies!
LEARNING THROUGH PLAY -- Our products inspire children to play with purpose. Play is the best teacher! Our high-quality, educational resources fulfill learning needs from 18 months to 12 years.
